Hi all.

I'm one of Ken Stanley's PhD students and will be presenting a pa=
per at
GECCO 2007 on using HyperNEAT to solve visual discrimination tasks. =
 The
paper, "Generating Large-Scale Neural Networks Through Discovering
Geo=
metric Regularities", can be seen here:
http://eplex.cs.ucf.edu/index.php?o=
ption=3Dcom_content&task=3Dview&id=3D14&Ite\
mid=3D28
<http://eplex.cs.ucf.=
edu/index.php?option=3Dcom_content&task=3Dview&id=3D14&It\
emid=3D28>

In c=
onjunction with the paper I will also be releasing my source code
under the=
 GPL  (or some similar) license within the next couple of
weeks.  The code =
is written in C++, is modular (NEAT is a separate
library for anyone wantin=
g straight NEAT code), and uses  CMake, which
means you can use whatever pr=
ogramming IDE you want to edit and build
the source.  Also, because I neede=
d to demostrate individuals with
millions of links in real time, the neural=
 network code is pretty highly
optimized.

For the time being I have a work=
-in-progress NEAT and HyperNEAT doxygen
up:

http://ucfpawn.homelinux.com/d=
oxygen/NEAT_docs/html/
<http://ucfpawn.homelinux.com/doxygen/NEAT_docs/html=
/>

http://ucfpawn.homelinux.com/doxygen/HyperNEAT_Docs/html/
<http://ucfpa=
wn.homelinux.com/doxygen/HyperNEAT_Docs/html/>



If anyone has any questio=
ns on the paper, I will try to answer them as
best as possible.  Thanks!


=


--1-8416800359-7621358553=:7
Content-Type: text/html; charset="iso-8859-1"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

<P>Hi all.</P>
<P>I'm one of Ken Stanley's PhD students and will be present=
ing a paper at GECCO 2007 on using HyperNEAT to solve visual discrimination=
 tasks.  The paper, "Generating Large-Scale Neural Networks Through Di=
scovering Geometric Regularities", can be seen here: <A href=3D"http://eple=
x.cs.ucf.edu/index.php?option=3Dcom_content&task=3Dview&id=3D14&amp=
;Itemid=3D28">http://eplex.cs.ucf.edu/index.php?option=3Dcom_content&ta=
sk=3Dview&id=3D14&Itemid=3D28</A></P>
<P>In conjunction with the pa=
per I will also be releasing my source code under the GPL  (or some si=
milar) license within the next couple of weeks.  The code is written i=
n C++, is modular (NEAT is a separate library for anyone wanting straight N=
EAT code), and uses  CMake, which means you can use whatever programmi=
ng IDE you want to edit and build the source.  Also, because I needed =
to demostrate individuals with millions of links in real time, the neural n=
etwork code is pretty highly optimized.</P>
<P>For the time being I have a =
work-in-progress NEAT and HyperNEAT doxygen up:</P>
<P><A href=3D"http://uc=
fpawn.homelinux.com/doxygen/NEAT_docs/html/">http://ucfpawn.homelinux.com/d=
oxygen/NEAT_docs/html/</A></P>
<P><A href=3D"http://ucfpawn.homelinux.com/d=
oxygen/HyperNEAT_Docs/html/">http://ucfpawn.homelinux.com/doxygen/HyperNEAT=
_Docs/html/</A></P>
<P> </P>
<P>If anyone has any questions on the pap=
er, I will try to answer them as best as possible.  Thanks!</P>
<P>&nb=
sp;</P>

--1-8416800359-7621358553=:7--
